intro: Epaltes hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy epaltes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its hairy leaves and yellow flowers are notable features, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Epaltes hirsuta is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
